DOC.brief_title: Incentives Promote Medication Adherence Among HIV-Infected Youth
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVE : - To describe effect novel incentive intervention model HIV-infected youth ' pattern antiretroviral medication adherence . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : - To evaluate feasibility outpatient incentive intervention model . - To assess participant satisfaction incentive intervention model . - To evaluate effect outpatient incentive intervention model target health behavior ( number miss appointment STI diagnosis ) . - To measure effect incentive intervention HIV viral load CD4+ count . - To determine overall per patient cost incentive intervention model . - To describe association adherence measure : real-time medication monitor data , pharmacy pill count , pharmacy prescription pick-up data , medication possession ratio , self-report . Upon enrollment , participant receive education real-time medication monitor . Participants follow monthly clinic prescribe thirty-day supply medication . During week 1-4 participant establish baseline real-time medication monitor . During week 5-28 , participant receive remote incentive base level medication adherence measure real-time medication monitor . Additional lottery-style incentive occur regular follow-up visit . No incentive apply week 29-48 . Participants complete protocol week 48 visit .
